sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners (NASDAQ: CEP) sponsor converts and cancels shares
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners' sponsor, Cantor EP Holdings, LLC, executed a series of share movements on December 8, 2025, involving the repayment of a promissory note with Class A shares, conversion of Class B to Class A shares, and the surrender and exchange of Class A shares. These transactions were part of a business combination and SPAC merger, resulting in the sponsor no longer holding any Class A or Class B shares of Cantor Equity Partners. The related SEC Form 4 filing details these activities, including the individuals and entities deemed to have beneficial ownership.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners (NASDAQ: CEP) wins approval for business combination and Nasdaq share issuance
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners (NASDAQ: CEP) has secured shareholder approval for its business combination with Twenty One Capital, Inc. and related entities at an extraordinary general meeting on December 3, 2025. Shareholders also approved Nasdaq share issuance proposals and various governance changes for the combined entity. With minimal redemptions, CEP expects to complete the business combination once the remaining conditions are met.

feed.title: Twenty One Capital and Cantor Equity Partners Announce Expected Closing of Business Combination and NYSE Listing
feed.summary: Twenty One Capital and Cantor Equity Partners (Nasdaq: CEP) announced that CEP shareholders approved their proposed business combination. The deal is expected to close around December 8, 2025, with the combined entity, Twenty One Capital, Inc., set to begin trading on the NYSE under the symbol "XXI" on December 9, 2025. This aims to create a publicly listed Bitcoin-native company providing exposure to Bitcoin through equity markets.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners IV Completes Successful IPO
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. successfully completed its Initial Public Offering (IPO) on August 22, 2025, raising $450 million by selling 45 million Class A ordinary shares at $10 each. The company also secured an additional $9 million through a private placement with Cantor EP Holdings IV, LLC. The total proceeds of $450 million have been placed in a U.S. trust account, earmarked for future business combinations, particularly targeting sectors like financial services, digital assets, healthcare, and technology.

feed.title: CEPF - Cantor Equity Partners Iv Inc. - Ordinary Shares - Class A Company Profile & Facts
feed.summary: This article provides a company profile and facts for Cantor Equity Partners IV Inc. - Ordinary Shares - Class A, listed under the ticker CEPF. It displays current stock information, including the price change, and indicates that no further data is available for this symbol. The page also includes navigation for financial tools and market data.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners IV completes $450 million IPO on Nasdaq
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. (CEPF) completed its initial public offering of 45 million Class A ordinary shares at $10.00 per share, raising $450 million. The shares began trading on the Nasdaq Global Market under the symbol "CEPF" on August 21, 2025. The company is a blank check company sponsored by Cantor Fitzgerald, aiming for mergers, acquisitions, or similar business combinations, with a focus on industries like financial services, digital assets, healthcare, and technology.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners IV raises $450 million in Nasdaq IPO
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. (NASDAQ:CEPF) successfully completed its initial public offering, raising $450 million by selling 45 million Class A ordinary shares at $10.00 each, including an overallotment option. The blank check company, sponsored by Cantor Fitzgerald, began trading on the Nasdaq Global Market under the ticker "CEPF" and intends to use the capital for business combinations, focusing on sectors like financial services and technology.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. Announces Closing of $450 Million Initial Public Offering
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. (Nasdaq: CEPF) announced the closing of its initial public offering, raising $450 million through the sale of 45,000,000 Class A ordinary shares at $10.00 each. The shares began trading on Nasdaq on August 21, 2025. The company is a blank check company sponsored by Cantor Fitzgerald, formed to pursue mergers or acquisitions in sectors like financial services, digital assets, healthcare, real estate, technology, and software.

feed.title: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. Announces Closing of $450 Million Initial Public Offering
feed.summary: Cantor Equity Partners IV, Inc. announced the closing of its initial public offering, raising $450 million. The company sold 45,000,000 Class A ordinary shares at $10.00 per share, including an overallotment option. The shares began trading on the Nasdaq Global Market under the symbol “CEPF” on August 21, 2025.
